title: Data
text: ccc collects corpus 28,228 rulings made Colombian Constitutional Court (CCC) cover period 32 years immediately first ruling published April 3, 1992. together, form complex citation network approximately 693,053 ties among . ruling standardized name (e.g., C-776-03, T-025-04, SU-1184-01). prefix refers type ruling; infix carries meaning; suffix indicates year ruling made. three types ruling: C refers cases CCC decides whether law, rule, administrative decision compatible constitutional norms‚Äîalso known judicial review. T refers tutela, individual complaint mechanism (special writ) aimed protection fundamental rights. tutelas give ordinary citizens power go ordinary judge request protection ‚Äúfundamental constitutional rights‚Äù whenever perceive threatened. year, CCC selects approximately 2% cases review, final decision may uphold reverse decisions made lower courts. lot cases related healthcare access pensions. SU refers decisions Court decided compile several T cases. sort legally binding ‚ÄúAnnual Reviews‚Äù judicial system Colombia.

title: Data
text: metadata contains information ruling. citations contains citation network ‚Äúedge list‚Äù format. citation weight refers number times ruling cites previous case. also convenient function turns two datasets squared adjacency matrix. resulting matrix MM sparse. 796,819,984 cells 0.087% non-zero. following figure best attempt visualizing whole thing:  Note. observe empty column, mean none rulings created particular time period cited future rulings (.e., rulings failed become precedent). observe empty row, mean none rulings created particular time period cited previous rulings. scenarios entirely hypothetical.

title: Data
text: citation network ùêå\mathbf M always directed, asymmetric, acyclic‚Äî.e., points backwards time. Let‚Äôs assume ùêå\mathbf M lower triangular, meaning elements main diagonal zero. happens documents arranged first last, rows represent source documents, columns represent target documents. main diagonal also zero won‚Äôt allow document cite . Note. direction citation can considered backwards time (.e., documents citing past documents) forwards time (.e., knowledge flowing documents future documents). use backward-looking convention. acyclic temporal graphs sort, -degree earliest node always zero -degree newest node also always zero. However, CCC matrix lower triangular. documents cite way creates illusion time travel court writing simultaneously. () cases ruling cite another one published couple months later. rulings modified many years later privacy concerns‚Äîe.g., T-1003-99. cases CCC modified original text ensure names parties involved rendered anonymous. sorts modifications usually prefaced small editorial note beginning document. document also accompanied small text‚Äîlabeled Auto 397/19‚Äîcontains citations future rulings deal issue anonymity public documents. examples kind time travel CCC dataset. Thus, upper triangular section ùêå\mathbf M matrix Colombian Constitutional Court various non-zero entries.
code: url <- "https://www.corteconstitucional.gov.co/relatoria/1999/T-1003-99.htm" txt <- ccc_txt(url) #> https://www.corteconstitucional.gov.co/relatoria/1999/T-1003-99.htm  txt |>    stringr::str_trunc(width = 300) |>    stringr::str_squish() |>    stringr::str_wrap() |>    cat() #> NOTA DE RELATORIA: Mediante auto 397 de fecha 19 de julio de 2019, el cual se #> anexa en la parte final de esta providencia, se ordena suprimir el nombre y los #> datos que permitan identificar al accionante y, en su lugar, sustituirlos por el #> nombre ficticio de ‚ÄúMiguel‚Äù. Sentencia T-1... sum(M[upper.tri(M)] > 0L) #> [1] 638

title: Data
text: See Denny Spirling (2018) -depth discussion various pre-processing steps (e.g., removal stop words, lemmatization, lowercasing). docterms dataset contains data frame document identifiers (doc_id) word counts (lemma n). 26,945,876 rows. dataset contains 28,228 unique documents vocabulary size 10,954. create_dtm() function creates sparse document-term matrix information contained docterms. Close 91% cells matrix empty, call ‚Äúsparse matrix.‚Äù random subset ùêÄ\mathbf{}: Note. still unsatisfied Spanish lemmatization provided spaCy, probably change future figure better way.
code: docterms #> # A tibble: 26,945,876 √ó 3 #>   doc_id   lemma         n #>   <fct>    <fct>     <int> #> 1 C-001-18 abierto       2 #> 2 C-001-18 abordar       1 #> 3 C-001-18 absoluto      1 #> 4 C-001-18 abstracto    12 #> 5 C-001-18 academia      3 #> 6 C-001-18 academico     1 #> # ‚Ñπ 26,945,870 more rows A <- create_dtm() dim(A) #> [1] 28228 10954 mean(A == 0L) #> [1] 0.9128556 set.seed(1111) i <- sample(1:nrow(A), 10) j <- sample(1:ncol(A), 5) A[i, j] #> 10 x 5 sparse Matrix of class "dgCMatrix" #>           abusivo rebajar pensionada transportador vulnerarir #> T-896-07        .       .          .             .          . #> T-863A-99       .       .          .             .          . #> T-052-20        .       .          .             .          . #> T-270-16        .       .          .             .          . #> T-726-98        .       .          .             .          . #> SU-415-15       .       .          .             .          . #> C-263-13        3       .          .             .          . #> T-062-11        .       .          .             .          . #> C-014-97        .       .          .             .          . #> T-300-19        .       .          .             .          .

title: Data
text: following Figure shows average -degree (citations) -degree (references) made ruling across years. Note , average, decisions written 1992 tend significantly cited ones written years, giving sort ‚Äúfirst-movers advantage‚Äù others‚Äî.e., innovative thing kind first kind.  Fowler Jeon (2008) interpret panel right evidence legal norm stare decisis becoming stronger, ‚Äôs definitely wishful thinking. Leskovec, Kleinberg, Faloutsos (2007) show -degree tends grow time many different kinds networks. following Figure disaggregates kinds citation type ruling.
code: metadata |>    pivot_longer(c(indegree, outdegree), names_to = "dtype", values_to = "degree") |>    mutate(dtype = case_when(     dtype == "indegree" ~ "Average Inward Citations (in-degree)",     dtype == "outdegree" ~ "Average Outward Citations (out-degree)"   )) |>    ggplot(aes(year, degree)) +    stat_summary(     fun.data = \(x) mean_cl_boot(x, conf.int = 0.95), size = 1/3,     shape = 21, fill = "white", stroke = 1/2   ) +    facet_grid(~dtype, scales = "free_y") +    scale_x_continuous(labels = seq(1992, 2022, 4), breaks = seq(1992, 2022, 4)) +   labs(y = NULL, x = NULL) +   theme(strip.text.y = element_text(angle = 0)) metadata |>    pivot_longer(c(indegree, outdegree), names_to = "dtype", values_to = "degree") |>    mutate(dtype = case_when(     dtype == "indegree" ~ "Average Inward Citations (in-degree)",     dtype == "outdegree" ~ "Average Outward Citations (out-degree)"   )) |>    ggplot(aes(year, degree)) +    stat_summary(     fun.data = \(x) mean_cl_boot(x, conf.int = 0.68), fatten = 1/2,     shape = 21, fill = "white", size = 1/10   ) +    facet_grid(type ~ dtype) +    scale_x_continuous(labels = seq(1992, 2022, 4), breaks = seq(1992, 2022, 4)) +   labs(y = NULL, x = NULL) +   theme(strip.text.y = element_text(angle = 0))

title: Data
text: Instead focusing -degree -degree, can follow Fowler Jeon (2008) calculating sophisticated measures centrality. key insight can transform original (unweighted) citation matrix two different ways: co-citation matrix two rulings connected total number rulings cite . cocitation() function igraph makes following calculation: ùêÇ=ùêå‚ä§ùêå \mathbf C = \mathbf{M}^\top \mathbf{M} bibliographic coupling, two rulings connected number common references. bibcoupling() function igraph makes following calculation: ùêÅ=ùêåùêå‚ä§ \mathbf{B} = \mathbf{MM}^\top , diagonal elements ùêÇ\mathbf{C} correspond -degree ruling (row sums ùêå\mathbf{M}); whereas diagonal elements ùêÅ\mathbf{B} correspond -degree ruling (column sums ùêå\mathbf{M}). Following Kleinberg (1999), Fowler Jeon (2008) calculate authority score hubs ruling. first eigenvectors ùêÇ\mathbf{C} ùêÅ\mathbf{B} respectively. Ronald Breiger noted ‚Äúseveral stories might , , told eigenvectors. low-dimensional scaffolds support higher-dimensional structures.‚Äù social networks, eigenvectors interpreted measure ‚Äúcentrality‚Äù roughly translates extent node well-connected well-connected nodes. case, story supposed go something like : authority score case depends number times cited quality cases cite . Symmetrically, hub score case depends number cases cites quality cases cited. Thus, authority scores indicate degree case thought important resolving important issues come Court, hub scores indicate degree case well-grounded previous important rulings. Fowler Jeon (2008, 17) Calculating scores pretty straightforward using igraph package: Measurements authority correlated -degree measurements, ‚Äôre thing.  Note. Given large number T cases, makes sense ‚Äúcentral‚Äù C rulings define tutela (C-543-92) clarify circumstances tutela can presented decisions made lower courts (C-590-05). goes ‚Äúhub‚Äù ‚Äú-degree‚Äù measurements.  Note. makes sense SU rulings heavily represented ‚Äúhubs.‚Äù Finally, note authority hub scores somewhat related ; however, definition, first rulings can never hubs last rulings can never authorities. Hence see three clusters.
code: net <- igraph::graph_from_data_frame(   ## we will use the unweighted edge list   d = citations |> select(!weight),    directed = TRUE,    vertices = metadata |> select(id, type, date, year, indegree, outdegree) )  V(net)$authority <- igraph::authority_score(net, scale = FALSE)$vector V(net)$hub <- igraph::hub_score(net, scale = FALSE)$vector igraph::as_data_frame(net, what = "vertices") |>    mutate(top = ifelse(rank(-authority) %in% 1:15, name, "")) |>    ggplot(aes(indegree, authority, color = type)) +    geom_point(alpha = 1/5) +    ggrepel::geom_text_repel(aes(label = top), size = 2.5, family = "Avenir", max.overlaps = 50) +    scale_x_log10()  #> Warning in scale_x_log10(): log-10 transformation introduced infinite values. #> log-10 transformation introduced infinite values. igraph::as_data_frame(net, what = "vertices") |>    mutate(top = if_else(rank(-hub) %in% 1:15, name, NA_character_)) |>    ggplot(aes(outdegree, hub, color = type)) +    geom_point(alpha = 1/5) +    ggrepel::geom_text_repel(aes(label = top), size = 2.5, family = "Avenir", max.overlaps = 50) +    scale_x_log10() #> Warning in scale_x_log10(): log-10 transformation introduced infinite values. #> log-10 transformation introduced infinite values. #> Warning: Removed 28213 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_text_repel()`). igraph::as_data_frame(net, what = "vertices") |>    ggplot(aes(authority, hub, color = date)) +    geom_point(alpha = 1/5, size = 1/3) +   scale_x_log10() + scale_y_log10() + scale_color_viridis_c(trans = "date") #> Warning in scale_x_log10(): log-10 transformation introduced #> infinite values. #> Warning in scale_y_log10(): log-10 transformation introduced #> infinite values.

title: Data
text: Along increase citations time, important feature CCC rulings evolved time concerns length document. variable called word_count metadata dataset allows us see changes time.
code: metadata |>    ggplot(aes(year, word_count)) +    stat_summary(     fun.data = \(x) mean_cl_boot(x, conf.int = 0.95), size = 1/3,     shape = 21, fill = "white", stroke = 1/2   ) +   scale_x_continuous(labels = seq(1992, 2022, 4), breaks = seq(1992, 2022, 4)) +   labs(y = "n", x = NULL, title = "Average Number of Words in Each Ruling Per Year")

title: Data
text: Gender gender_cases contains cases related gender equality across variety topics, collected domain experts . Transitional Justice jctt_* datasets contain cases ‚ÄúJusticia Constitucional en Tiempos de Transici√≥n‚Äù project, collected researchers affiliated Universidad de Los Andes. jctt_edge_list contains citation data sources ‚Äúoutside‚Äù CCC (e.g., international law).

title: Search and Download
text: Use ccc_search() function look cases. data little messy. ccc_clean_dataset() provides useful tidying, might want consider things differently.
code: results <- ccc_search(   text = "familia",    date_start = "2000-01-01",    date_end = "2001-12-31" )  glimpse(results) #> Rows: 1,552 #> Columns: 14 #> $ relevancia                           <dbl> 18.308, 8.892, 4.902, 4.897, 4.89‚Ä¶ #> $ providencia                          <chr> "T-1045/01", "T-1532/00", "T-029/‚Ä¶ #> $ tipo                                 <chr> "Tutela", "Tutela", "Tutela", "Tu‚Ä¶ #> $ fecha_sentencia                      <chr> "2001-10-03", "2000-11-15", "2001‚Ä¶ #> $ magistrado_s_ponentes                <chr> "", "Carlos Gaviria D√≠az", "Aleja‚Ä¶ #> $ magistrado_s_s_alvamento_a_claracion <lgl> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N‚Ä¶ #> $ tema_subtema                         <chr> "", "ACCION DE TUTELA TRANSITORIA‚Ä¶ #> $ demandado                            <chr> "Sin Informaci√≥n", "", "", "Sin I‚Ä¶ #> $ demandante                           <chr> "MARIA SANDRA CRUZ PERDOMO VS. IN‚Ä¶ #> $ expediente                           <chr> "469070", "T-324358 Y OTROS", "T-‚Ä¶ #> $ f_public                             <chr> "", "", "", "", "", "", "", "", "‚Ä¶ #> $ normas                               <chr> "", "", "", "", "CODIGO CIVIL. AR‚Ä¶ #> $ sintesis                             <chr> "", "", "", "", "", "", "", "", "‚Ä¶ #> $ url                                  <chr> "https://www.corteconstitucional.‚Ä¶ df <- ccc_clean_dataset(results) glimpse(df) #> Rows: 1,552 #> Columns: 9 #> $ id          <chr> "T-001-00", "A-001-00", "T-002-00", "T-007-00", "T-005-00"‚Ä¶ #> $ type        <fct> T, A, T, T, T, T, T, T, C, C, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T‚Ä¶ #> $ year        <int> 2000, 2000, 2000, 2000, 2000, 2000, 2000, 2000, 2000, 2000‚Ä¶ #> $ date        <date> 2000-01-12, 2000-01-12, 2000-01-13, 2000-01-13, 2000-01-1‚Ä¶ #> $ descriptors <list> <"DERECHO A LA ATENCION MEDICA INTEGRAL DE ANCIANO-Examen‚Ä¶ #> $ mp          <list> "jose gregorio hernandez galindo", "jose gregorio hernand‚Ä¶ #> $ date_public <date> NA, 2000-01-28, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N‚Ä¶ #> $ file        <chr> "T-245392", "T-246504", "T-235171", "T-246991", "T-239345"‚Ä¶ #> $ url         <chr> "https://www.corteconstitucional.gov.co/relatoria/2000/T-0‚Ä¶

title: Search and Download
text: Next ‚Äôll want download texts. can use either ccc_txt() ccc_rtf(). prefer ccc_txt() seems .rtf files don‚Äôt include footnotes. download first ruling: ‚Äôd download first 5 rulings: text look something like : Sentencia T-001/00 ¬† DERECHO LA ATENCION MEDICA INTEGRAL DE ANCIANO-Examen urgente/REVISION FALLO DE TUTELA-Fallecimiento del actor ¬† La Corte considera necesario subrayar que la actividad de las entidades responsables de mantener la seguridad social en cuanto se refiere las personas de la tercera edad est√°n sujetas la exigencia espec√≠fica de cobijar todos los aspectos de la salud de los beneficiarios, que otro es el significado de la expresi√≥n ‚Äúintegral‚Äù, usada por el Constituyente para referirse al contenido de la seguridad social que debe brindarse los ancianos. Por tanto, el alcance de la protecci√≥n y de los servicios cargo de tales entes va mucho m√°s all√° del puro tr√°mite de citas y consultas m√©dicas, pues comprende el diagn√≥stico, la prevenci√≥n, los tratamientos, los cuidados cl√≠nicos, los medicamentos, las cirug√≠as, las terapias y todos aquellos elementos de atenci√≥n que aseguren la eficiente cobertura de la seguridad social favor de las personas de la tercera edad. La conducta negligente de la demandada y la negativa brindar la atenci√≥n requerida, es muy factible que haya incidido y de manera definitiva, en su pronto deceso. ¬† DERECHO LA SALUD-Pr√°ctica inmediata e √≠ntegra de ex√°menes ordenados ¬† SENTENCIA INHIBITORIA EN TUTELA-Improcedencia ¬† pudiendo ser inhibitoria la decisi√≥n por mandato del art√≠culo 29, par√°grafo, del Decreto 2591 de 1991, habr√° de ser negativa, por haberse encontrado indemnes los derechos invocados, ni por entenderse exonerada la persona o entidad demandada, sino justamente por ser in√∫til e irrealizable -dadas las circunstancias- el prove√≠do judicial, aun comprobada la conducta inconstitucional del sujeto pasivo de la demanda, como en el presente caso ocurre. ¬† Referencia: Expediente T-245392 ¬† Acci√≥n de tutela instaurada por Mar√≠a Arledia Garc√≠a Garc√≠a contra el Seguro Social, Seccional Antioquia ¬† Magistrado Ponente: Dr.¬†JOS√â GREGORIO HERN√ÅNDEZ GALINDO ¬† ‚Ä¶
code:
txt <- ccc_txt(df$url[[1]]) #> https://www.corteconstitucional.gov.co/relatoria/2000/T-001-00.htm txts <- lapply(df$url[1:5], ccc_txt) #> https://www.corteconstitucional.gov.co/relatoria/2000/T-001-00.htm #> https://www.corteconstitucional.gov.co/relatoria/autos/2000/A001-00.htm #> https://www.corteconstitucional.gov.co/relatoria/2000/T-002-00.htm #> https://www.corteconstitucional.gov.co/relatoria/2000/T-007-00.htm #> https://www.corteconstitucional.gov.co/relatoria/2000/T-005-00.htm names(txts) <- df$id[1:5] glimpse(txts) #> List of 5 #>  $ T-001-00: chr "

¬†
 DEBIDO PROCESO DE TUTELA-Notificaci√≥n iniciaci√≥n de la acci√≥n

 Si bie"| __truncated__ #>  $ T-002-00: chr "
